alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Newberry; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland; Saluda; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Newberry, Calhoun, Lexington, southwestern Sumter, southeastern Saluda, north central Orangeburg and Richland Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 1000 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Ridge Spring to near St. Matthews. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Murray Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Sumter, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Batesburg-Leesville, Dentsville, Oak Grove, South Sumter, St. Andrews, McEntire Air Base, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Red Bank, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, St. Matthews, Gaston and Arcadia Lakes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 37 and 79. Interstate 26 between mile markers 94 and 141. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Lexington; Newberry; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland; Saluda; Sumter
